comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: Hallelujah she's back!!!  Took your time putting up the stuff.  We really missed you and your virtual sticky buns.  Baby the elephant went berserk in Cork looking for them!  I note that apart from the pack of hounds there are no stray mongrels or other dogs on view?  Perhaps it was too risky?

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/swordscookie] Give a girl a moment to catch her breath! How do?  :)

We need to catch up with all the March Pic of the Day, and then we'll be right up to date and normal service will resume...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 30687643@N00
comment._content: Welcome back! A few ladies riding side-saddle I see, it looks very difficult!

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/mogey] Thanks, Moira! Side-saddle looks terrifying. Don't know how anyone did it, and jumped fences side-saddle too...

comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] The notes we dug up on the Lara last time said she was sold and broken up in 1908.

comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: It could be the Dunbrody, renamed Arklow in 1912 when the Waterford steamship company was taken over by the Clyde shipping company.
